DataElement.preferredName: Glioblastoma Slide Greater Than or Equal To Twenty From Prior Surgery Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient has at least 20 (preferably 40) slides of archival tumor tissue from a prior surgery demonstrating GBM.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Glioblastoma Slide Greater Than or Equal To Twenty From Prior Surgery Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most malignant astrocytic tumor (WHO grade IV).  It is composed of poorly differentiated neoplastic astrocytes and it is characterized by the presence of cellular polymorphism, nuclear atypia, brisk mitotic activity, vascular thrombosis, microvascular proliferation and necrosis. It typically affects adults and is preferentially located in the cerebral hemispheres. It may develop from diffuse astrocytoma WHO grade II or anaplastic astrocytoma (secondary glioblastoma), but more frequently, it manifests after a short clinical history de novo, without evidence of a less malignant precursor lesion (primary glioblastoma). Two histologic variants are recognized: giant cell glioblastoma and gliosarcoma. (WHO)_A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._Earlier in time or order._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most malignant astrocytic tumor (WHO grade IV).  It is composed of poorly differentiated neoplastic astrocytes and it is characterized by the presence of cellular polymorphism, nuclear atypia, brisk mitotic activity, vascular thrombosis, microvascular proliferation and necrosis. It typically affects adults and is preferentially located in the cerebral hemispheres. It may develop from diffuse astrocytoma WHO grade II or anaplastic astrocytoma (secondary glioblastoma), but more frequently, it manifests after a short clinical history de novo, without evidence of a less malignant precursor lesion (primary glioblastoma). Two histologic variants are recognized: giant cell glioblastoma and gliosarcoma. (WHO):A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: The most malignant astrocytic tumor (WHO grade 4).  It is composed of poorly differentiated neoplastic astrocytes and is characterized by the presence of cellular polymorphism, nuclear atypia, brisk mitotic activity, vascular thrombosis, microvascular proliferation, and necrosis. It typically affects adults and is preferentially located in the cerebral hemispheres. (Adapted from WHO)
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Twenty From Prior Surgical Procedure Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.:Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:Earlier in time or order.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have at leas
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have at least 20 (preferably 40) slides of archival tumor tissue from a prior surgery demonstrating GBM?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Heart Condition with Treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ischemic myocardial event, including  angina requiring therapy  and artery revascularization procedures

ReferenceDocuments.name: Brain Condition with Treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ischemic cerebrovascular event, including TIA and artery revascularization procedures

ReferenceDocuments.name: Treatment for Heart Condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: Requirement for inotropic support (excluding digoxin) or serious (uncontrolled) cardiac arrhythmia (including atrial flutter/fibrillation, ventricular fibrillation or ventricular tachycardia)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Heart Treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Placement of a pacemaker for control of rhythm

ReferenceDocuments.name: Heart Condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III or IV heart failure (See Appendix II)
